sub_topic: Calculation of latent heat of fusion of a substance
message_1: What is the amount of heat required to melt 500 grams of ice at 0°C and convert it into water at the same temperature? The latent heat of fusion of ice is 335 J/g.
message_2:
To calculate the amount of heat required to melt 500 grams of ice at 0°C and convert it into water at the same temperature, we can use the formula:

Q = m * Lf

where Q is the amount of heat required, m is the mass of the ice, and Lf is the latent heat of fusion of ice.

Given:
m = 500 grams
Lf = 335 J/g

Plugging the values into the formula:

Q = 500 g * 335 J/g

Q = 167500 J

So, the amount of heat required to melt 500 grams of ice at 0°C and convert it into water at the same temperature is 167,500 Joules.
